trimMaxContiguous

public Gene trimMaxContiguous(Gene region,
                              double quantile)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Trim a region to a contiguous subregion with max number of positions having coverage above the quantile

Parameters:
region - The original region
quantile - The coverage quantile of the original region
Returns:
The contiguous subregion with maximal number of positions having coverage above the quantile of the original region or null if can't trim
Throws:
java.io.IOException

filterGenesByExpression

public java.util.List<Gene> filterGenesByExpression(java.util.Map<Gene,java.util.List<java.lang.Double>> countsMap)
This function will filter the genes in the input Map by a number of constraints on the total number of reads on the genes 1. All genes with expression < 5.0 read counts will be removed 2. All genes with expression in the 75th quantile of the remaining expressed genes will be returned

Parameters:
countsMap: - A map of RefSeqGene to a List of counts along the length of the gene
Returns:
